message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.FL, cs.SE, cs.LG

This paper deals with the termination/non-termination property of loops, which is a topic in the field of formal methods and program analysis. The use of second-order logic and the focus on decidability suggest that the paper is likely to belong to the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category. However, the paper also involves programming language theory (cs.PL) and formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL) due to the use of loop abstractions and the consideration of language restrictions. The paper may also be relevant to software engineering (cs.SE) and machine learning (cs.LG) due to the practical applications of loop analysis and the potential for incorporating loop termination information into learning algorithms.
